title: geobounds: Accessing Global Administrative Boundary Data in R
text: geobounds package provides straightforward interface downloading working global political administrative boundary data geoBoundaries project (Runfola et al. 2020). datasets openly licensed (CC 4.0) cover countries worldwide across multiple administrative levels. geobounds, can easily fetch boundary geometries sf objects, explore metadata, cache datasets locally, seamlessly integrate boundaries spatial workflows.

title: geobounds: Accessing Global Administrative Boundary Data in R
text: geoBoundaries database undergoes rigorous quality assurance process, including manual review hand-digitization physical maps necessary. primary goal provide highest possible level spatial accuracy scientific academic applications. precision comes cost: files can quite large may take longer download. visualization general mapping purposes, recommend using simplified datasets available setting simplified = TRUE. Comparison full vs. simplified map.
code: library(geobounds) library(ggplot2) library(dplyr)  # Different resolutions norway <- get_geobn_adm0("NOR") %>%   mutate(res = "Full resolution") print(object.size(norway), units = "Mb") #> 26.5 Mb  norway_simp <- get_geobn_adm0(country = "NOR", simplified = TRUE) %>%   mutate(res = "Simplified") print(object.size(norway_simp), units = "Mb") #> 1.5 Mb  norway_all <- bind_rows(norway, norway_simp)  # Plot ggplot2  library(ggplot2)  ggplot(norway_all) +   geom_sf(fill = "#BA0C2F") +   facet_wrap(vars(res)) +   theme_minimal() +   labs(caption = "Source: www.geoboundaries.org")

title: geobounds: Accessing Global Administrative Boundary Data in R
text: geoBoundaries API provides individual country files, whose aim represent every nation “represent ”, special identification disputed areas. download data implemented get_geobn() get_geobn_adm*() family functions. guaranteed borders align perfectly gaps countries. Additionally, files include special identification disputed areas. Map showing Western Sahara part Morocco.
code: # Files may intersect check_int <- get_geobn(c("Austria", "Germany"))  # Intersects? sf::st_intersects(check_int[1, ], check_int[2, ], sparse = FALSE) %>%   as.vector() #> [1] TRUE  # Disputed areas e.g. Morocco includes Western Sahara  mor <- get_geobn_adm0("Morocco")  ggplot(mor) +   geom_sf() +   labs(caption = "Source: www.geoboundaries.org")

title: geobounds: Accessing Global Administrative Boundary Data in R
text: prefer data explicitly includes disputed areas, please use get_geobn_world(). function downloads global composite datasets administrative boundaries, also known CGAZ (Comprehensive Global Administrative Zones). two important distinctions CGAZ individual country downloads: Extensive simplification performed ensure file sizes small enough used traditional desktop software. Disputed areas removed replaced polygons following US Department State definitions. Map showing Morocco provided CGAZ.
code: mor_cgaz <- get_geobn_world() %>%   filter(shapeGroup == "MAR")  ggplot(mor_cgaz) +   geom_sf() +   labs(caption = "Source: www.geoboundaries.org")

title: geobounds: Accessing Global Administrative Boundary Data in R
text: package provides built-mechanism cache files locally repeated downloads country/level use cached version. example: Specific cache directories function call can set using cache_dir argument function.
code: # Current folder current <- geobn_detect_cache_dir()  current #> [1] "C:\\Users\\diego\\AppData\\Local\\Temp\\RtmpSwB51m"  # Change to new newdir <- file.path(tempdir(), "/geoboundvignette") geobn_set_cache_dir(newdir) #> ℹ geobounds cache dir is 'C:\Users\diego\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpSwB51m//geoboundvignette'. #> ℹ To install your `cache_dir` path for use in future sessions run this function with `install = TRUE`.  # Download example <- get_geobn_adm0("Vatican City", verbose = TRUE) #> ℹ File 'C:\Users\diego\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpSwB51m/geoboundvignette/gbOpen/geoBoundaries-VAT-ADM0.geojson' already cached  # Restore cache dir geobn_set_cache_dir(current) #> ℹ geobounds cache dir is 'C:\Users\diego\AppData\Local\Temp\RtmpSwB51m'. #> ℹ To install your `cache_dir` path for use in future sessions run this function with `install = TRUE`.  current == geobn_detect_cache_dir() #> [1] TRUE

title: geobounds: Accessing Global Administrative Boundary Data in R
text: boundaries returned sf objects, can easily use combination spatial data: Clip raster data administrative units Compute zonal statistics Create choropleth maps Perform spatial joins survey tabular data example create choropleth map using metadata individual files boundaries data CGAZ: World Bank Income Group: Latin America Caribbean
code: # Metadata  latam_meta <- get_geobn_meta(boundary_type = "ADM0") %>%   select(boundaryISO, boundaryName, Continent, worldBankIncomeGroup) %>%   filter(Continent == "Latin America and the Caribbean") %>%   glimpse() #> Rows: 47 #> Columns: 4 #> $ boundaryISO          <chr> "ABW", "AIA", "ARG", "ATG", "BES", "BHS", "BLM", "BLZ", "BOL", "BR… #> $ boundaryName         <chr> "Aruba", "Anguilla", "Argentina", "Antigua and Barbuda", "Bonaire … #> $ Continent            <chr> "Latin America and the Caribbean", "Latin America and the Caribbea… #> $ worldBankIncomeGroup <chr> "High-income Countries", "No income group available", "High-income…  # Adjust factors latam_meta$income_factor <- factor(latam_meta$worldBankIncomeGroup,   levels = c(     "High-income Countries",     "Upper-middle-income Countries",     "Lower-middle-income Countries",     "Low-income Countries"   ) )  # Get the shapes from CGAZ latam_sf <- get_geobn_world(boundary_type = "ADM0") %>%   inner_join(latam_meta,     by =       c("shapeGroup" = "boundaryISO")   )  ggplot(latam_sf) +   geom_sf(aes(fill = income_factor)) +   scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Greens", direction = -1) +   guides(fill = guide_legend(position = "bottom", nrow = 2)) +   labs(     title = "World Bank Income Group",     subtitle = "Latin America and the Caribbean",     fill = "",     caption = "Source: www.geoboundaries.org"   )

title: geobounds: Accessing Global Administrative Boundary Data in R
text: geobounds package makes easy fetch, manage visualise administrative boundary data worldwide reproducible efficient way. Whether ’re mapping, spatial analysis, survey integration geospatial modelling, gives high-quality boundary dataset minimal overhead.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributing to geobounds
text: outlines propose change geobounds. detailed discussion contributing tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide code review principles.

title: Contributing to geobounds
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to geobounds
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to geobounds
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("dieghernan/geobounds", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to geobounds
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use Air apply style, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to geobounds
text: Please note geobounds project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

what: geobounds | R package for download geodata from geoBoundaries
title: geobounds | R package for download geodata from geoBoundaries
text: Attribution required using geoBoundaries.

title: geobounds | R package for download geodata from geoBoundaries
text: geobounds package provides R-friendly interface access work geoBoundaries dataset (open-license global database administrative boundary polygons). Using package, can: Programmatically retrieve administrative boundary geometries (e.g., country → region → district) geoBoundaries Use tidyverse / sf workflows R map, analyse join boundaries data Work open-data context (geoBoundaries uses CC -4.0 / open licences) short: work geospatial boundaries R (shape files, polygons, join data), package simplifies process.

title: geobounds | R package for download geodata from geoBoundaries
text: can install developing version geobounds : Alternatively, can install geobounds using r-universe:
code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("dieghernan/geobounds") # Install geobounds in R: install.packages("geobounds",   repos = c(     "https://dieghernan.r-universe.dev",     "https://cloud.r-project.org"   ) )

title: geobounds | R package for download geodata from geoBoundaries
text: Note: simple illustration. See package vignettes full details parameters, filters, caching, advanced usage.
code: library(geobounds)  sri_lanka_adm1 <- get_geobn_adm1("Sri Lanka") sri_lanka_adm2 <- get_geobn_adm2("Sri Lanka") sri_lanka_adm3 <- get_geobn_adm3("Sri Lanka")  library(sf) library(dplyr)  library(ggplot2)  ggplot(sri_lanka_adm3) +   geom_sf(fill = "#DFDFDF", color = "white") +   geom_sf(data = sri_lanka_adm2, fill = NA, color = "#F0B323") +   geom_sf(data = sri_lanka_adm1, fill = NA, color = "black") +   labs(caption = "Source: www.geoboundaries.org") +   theme_void()

what: Clear your geobounds cache dir — geobn_clear_cache
title: Clear your geobounds cache dir — geobn_clear_cache
text: Use function caution. function clear cached data configuration, specifically: Deletes geobounds config directory (tools::R_user_dir("geobounds", "config")). Deletes cache_dir directory. Deletes values stored Sys.getenv("GEOBN_CACHE_DIR") options(mapSpain_cache_dir).

title: Clear your geobounds cache dir — geobn_clear_cache
code: geobn_clear_cache(config = FALSE, cached_data = TRUE, verbose = FALSE)

title: Clear your geobounds cache dir — geobn_clear_cache
text: config Logical. TRUE, delete configuration folder geobounds. cached_data Logical. TRUE, delete cache_dir content. verbose Logical, displays information. Useful debugging, default FALSE.

title: Clear your geobounds cache dir — geobn_clear_cache

what: Set your geobounds cache dir — geobn_set_cache_dir
title: Set your geobounds cache dir — geobn_set_cache_dir
text: function store cache_dir path local machine load future sessions. Type Sys.getenv("GEOBN_CACHE_DIR") find cached path. Alternatively, can store cache_dir manually following options: Run Sys.setenv(GEOBN_CACHE_DIR = "cache_dir"). need run command session (Similar install = FALSE). Write line .Renviron file: GEOBN_CACHE_DIR = "value_for_cache_dir" (behavior install = TRUE). store cache_dir permanently.

title: Set your geobounds cache dir — geobn_set_cache_dir
code: geobn_set_cache_dir(   cache_dir,   overwrite = FALSE,   install = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Set your geobounds cache dir — geobn_set_cache_dir
text: cache_dir path cache directory. missing value function store cached files temporary dir (See base::tempdir()). overwrite Logical. set TRUE, overwrite existing GEOBN_CACHE_DIR already local machine. install Logical. TRUE, install key local machine use future sessions.  Defaults FALSE. cache_dir FALSE parameter set FALSE automatically. verbose Logical, displays information. Useful debugging, default FALSE.

title: Set your geobounds cache dir — geobn_set_cache_dir
text: (invisible) character path cache_dir.

what: Get individual country files from geoBoundaries — get_geobn
title: Get individual country files from geoBoundaries — get_geobn
text: Attribution required uses dataset. function returns data individual countries "represent ", special identification disputed areas.

title: Get individual country files from geoBoundaries — get_geobn
code: get_geobn(   country,   release_type = c("gbOpen", "gbHumanitarian", "gbAuthoritative"),   boundary_type = c("ADM0", "ADM1", "ADM2", "ADM3", "ADM4", "ALL"),   simplified = FALSE,   metadata = FALSE,   verbose = FALSE,   update_cache = FALSE,   cache_dir = NULL )

title: Get individual country files from geoBoundaries — get_geobn
text: geoboundaries API Service https://www.geoboundaries.org/api.html.

title: Get individual country files from geoBoundaries — get_geobn
text: country character vector country codes. either "" (return data countries), vector country names vector ISO3 country codes. Mixed types (c("Italy","ES","FRA")) work. See also countrycode::countrycode(). release_type One "gbOpen", "gbHumanitarian", "gbAuthoritative"`. Source spatial data. See Details. boundary_type Type boundary Accepted values "" (available boundaries) ADM level ("ADM0" country boundary, "ADM1" first level sub national boundaries, "ADM2" second level . simplified Logical. Return simplified boundary . metadata result metadata boundary? verbose Logical, displays information. Useful debugging, default FALSE. update_cache logical whether update cache. Default FALSE. set TRUE force fresh download source .geojson file. cache_dir path cache directory. See geobn_set_cache_dir().

title: Get individual country files from geoBoundaries — get_geobn
text: metadata = FALSE: sf object. metadata = TRUE: tibble.

title: Get individual country files from geoBoundaries — get_geobn
text: users, suggest using "gbOpen", CC-4.0 compliant, can used purposes long attribution provided. "gbHumanitarian" files mirrored UN OCHA, may less open licensure. "gbAuthoritative" files mirrored UN SALB,  used commercial purposes, verified -country processes.

title: Get individual country files from geoBoundaries — get_geobn
text: Runfola, D. et al. (2020) geoBoundaries: global database political administrative boundaries. PLoS ONE 15(4): e0231866. doi:10.1371/journal.pone.0231866 .

what: Get country files from geoBoundaries for a given administration level — get_geobn_adm
title: Get country files from geoBoundaries for a given administration level — get_geobn_adm
text: Attribution required uses dataset. functions wrappers get_geobn() extracting given administration level: get_geobn_adm0() returns country boundary. get_geobn_adm1() returns first-level administration boundaries (e.g. States United States). get_geobn_adm2() returns second-level administration boundaries (e.g. Counties United States). get_geobn_adm3() returns third-level administration boundaries (e.g. towns cities countries). get_geobn_adm3() returns fourth-level administration boundaries. Note countries number levels.

title: Get country files from geoBoundaries for a given administration level — get_geobn_adm

text: country character vector country codes. either "" (return data countries), vector country names vector ISO3 country codes. Mixed types (c("Italy","ES","FRA")) work. See also countrycode::countrycode(). release_type One "gbOpen", "gbHumanitarian", "gbAuthoritative"`. Source spatial data. See Details. simplified Logical. Return simplified boundary . metadata result metadata boundary? verbose Logical, displays information. Useful debugging, default FALSE. update_cache logical whether update cache. Default FALSE. set TRUE force fresh download source .geojson file. cache_dir path cache directory. See geobn_set_cache_dir().

text: geoboundaries API Service https://www.geoboundaries.org/api.html.

title: Get global composites data from geoBoundaries — get_geobn_world
text: boundary_type Type boundary Accepted values ADM level ("ADM0" country boundary, "ADM1" first level sub national boundaries, "ADM2" second level). verbose Logical, displays information. Useful debugging, default FALSE. update_cache logical whether update cache. Default FALSE. set TRUE force fresh download source .gpkg file. cache_dir path cache directory. See geobn_set_cache_dir().

title: Get global composites data from geoBoundaries — get_geobn_world
text: sf object.

title: Get global composites data from geoBoundaries — get_geobn_world
text: Comprehensive Global Administrative Zones (CGAZ) set global composites administrative boundaries. two important distinctions global product individual country downloads. Extensive simplification performed ensure file sizes small enough used traditional desktop software. Disputed areas removed replaced polygons following US Department State definitions.

text: Runfola, D. et al. (2020) geoBoundaries: global database political administrative boundaries. PLoS ONE 15(4): e0231866. doi:10.1371/journal.pone.0231866 .
